etymology.description: phonetic: 羊(羊) (yáng, "sheep") + semantic: 永(永) (yǒng, "eternal") = phonetic element combined with the idea of flowing water -> river
etymology.interpretation: The character 羕 combines 羊(羊) (yáng, "sheep") for its phonetic properties with 永(永) (yǒng, "eternal") to evoke the enduring flow of a river. The choice of 永 as the semantic component aligns with the concept of water perpetually flowing like an eternal cycle.
